title: Refraction - speed for angles of 45 and 80 degrees

content.question: Light is refracted at an interface between two transparent materials, as shown in the figure. In the first material the light moves at a speed of <math alttext="1.5 times 10 to the eighth power, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>8</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> and is incident on the interface at an angle of <math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>45</mn><mo>°</mo></math> from the normal. In the second material, the light’s angle from the normal is <math alttext="80 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>80</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the speed of light in the second material?

choices.label: <math alttext="3.7 times 10 to the seventh power, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>7</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1.1 times 10 to the eighth power, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>8</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

<math alttext="2.1 times 10 to the eighth power, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>8</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

<math alttext="2.7 times 10 to the eighth power, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>8</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2.1 times 10 to the eighth power, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>8</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
